total_revenue.context: Q2 2025 revenue was $9.33 billion, up 8% year-over-year in nominal and 9% in constant currency.

subscription_support_revenue.context: Subscription and support revenue grew 9% year-over-year in nominal and 10% in constant currency.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year '25 GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $6.05 to $6.13.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year '25 non-GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $10.03 to $10.11.

non_gaap_operating_margin.context: Q2 2025 non-GAAP operating margin was 33.7%, up 210 basis points year-over-year.

gaap_operating_margin.context: Fiscal year '25 GAAP operating margin guidance of approximately 20%, representing a 550 basis point improvement year-over-year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Q2 2025 operating cash flow was $892 million, up 10% year-over-year.

free_cash_flow.context: Q2 2025 free cash flow was $755 million, up 20% year-over-year.

full_year_operating_cash_flow.context: Fiscal year '25 operating cash flow reached $10.2 billion, up 44% year-over-year.

full_year_free_cash_flow.context: Fiscal year '25 free cash flow was $9.5 billion, up 50% year-over-year.

capital_expenditures.context: Fiscal year '25 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2% of revenue.

records_ingested.context: In Q2 2025, Data Cloud processed 2.3 quadrillion records, a 110% platform consumption growth year-over-year.

platform_consumption_growth.context: Platform consumption grew by 110% year-over-year in Q2 2025.

paid_customers_growth.context: In Q2 2025, the number of paid Data Cloud customers grew 130% year-over-year.

high_spend_customers.description: Number of customers spending more than $1 million annually
high_spend_customers.context: The number of customers spending more than $1 million annually nearly doubled in Q2 2025.

ai_deals_closed.context: Salesforce signed 1,500 AI deals in Q2 2025.

einstein_transactions.context: Delivered 25 trillion Einstein transactions across all clouds during Q2 2025.

trailhead_learners.context: 35,000 Salesforce employees are using Einstein as a trusted AI assistant.

agentforce.description: New AI platform integrating agents across Salesforce applications.
agentforce.context: Introduced Agentforce, an autonomous AI agent platform to augment sales, service, marketing, and commerce functions.

transformation_plan.description: Accelerated transformation focusing on financial discipline and AI-driven growth.
initiatives: AI transformation with the launch of Agentforce.
Integration of Agentforce with Data Cloud and Einstein.
goals: Achieve non-GAAP operating margins of 32.8% in FY '25.
Raise fiscal year '25 operating cash flow growth to 23-25% year-over-year.
Deploy Agentforce agents across various roles and industries.
Transform customer and employee experiences with AI.
examples: Launched Agentforce agents for sales and service.
Enabled customers like Saks, FedEx, Air India to deploy Agentforce.
Established Zero Copy Partner Network with Amazon, Databricks, Google, IBM, Microsoft, and Snowflake.

market_position.description: Maintaining leadership in CRM and advancing to become the #1 AI CRM.
initiatives: Maintaining #1 CRM provider ranking by IDC for the 11th year.
Strengthening position as the second largest enterprise software company globally.
goals: Become the #1 AI CRM in the industry.
Expand to become the largest enterprise software application company.
examples: Passed Oracle in Japan to become the second largest enterprise software company.
Achieved 80% of new business driven by multi-cloud deals in Q2 2025.
Recognized as the #1 AI CRM with strong growth in Einstein transactions.

innovation.description: Focus on AI innovations with Agentforce and Data Cloud to drive customer success.
initiatives: Launching Agentforce for autonomous AI agents.
Enhancing Data Cloud for unified customer data and metadata.
Integrating AI capabilities across all Salesforce clouds.
goals: Enable customers to deploy autonomous AI agents at scale.
Provide a unified platform for data and AI-driven insights.
Drive productivity and efficiency through AI automation.
examples: Agentforce platform enabling 90% case resolution for healthcare companies.
Wiley achieved a 50% increase in case resolution with Agentforce.
OpenTable using Agentforce to manage 160 million diners.

ecosystem_development.description: Expanding the Salesforce ecosystem through strategic partnerships and integrations.
initiatives: Building Agentforce ecosystem with partners like Workday.
Expanding Zero Copy Partner Network with major technology companies.
Enhancing Slack integration with AI capabilities.
goals: Create a robust ecosystem for deploying Agentforce agents.
Enable seamless data integration and federation across platforms.
Support partner-driven innovation and customer success.
examples: Workday as the first Agentforce partner.
Collaborations with AWS, Databricks, Google, IBM, Microsoft, and Snowflake.
Slack AI summarizing 420 million messages in Q2 2025.

social_initiatives.description: Commitment to supporting nonprofits, sustainability, and ethical AI developments.
initiatives: Delivering $450 million in grants and 6 million volunteer hours.
Achieving net zero gas emissions and providing a carbon-neutral cloud.
Integrating Slack to support collaborative and sustainable work environments.
goals: Empower nonprofit, education, and philanthropy customers to fulfill their missions.
Reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
examples: Salesforce.org supporting 51,000 nonprofits with free services.
$450 million in grants delivered to various causes.
Carbon-neutral cloud and commitment to renewable energy initiatives.

revenue_growth.expectation: Continued growth driven by multi-cloud adoption, industry solutions, and geographical expansion despite economic headwinds.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to remain strong or accelerate in upcoming quarters.
factors: Growth in Salesforce platform and cloud services.
Successful integration of acquisitions like MuleSoft and Tableau.
Increased demand for digital transformation and customer experience solutions.

revenue.context: Fiscal year '25 revenue guidance of $37.7 billion to $38 billion, representing 8% to 9% projected growth year-over-year.

non_gaap_operating_margin.context: Fiscal year '25 non-GAAP operating margin guidance of 32.8%, representing a 230 basis point improvement year-over-year.

gaap_operating_margin.context: Fiscal year '25 GAAP operating margin guidance of approximately 20%, representing a 550 basis point improvement year-over-year.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year '25 GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $6.05 to $6.13.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year '25 non-GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $10.03 to $10.11.

operating_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year '25 operating cash flow growth expected to be approximately 23% to 25% year-over-year, inclusive of cash tax headwind.

capital_expenditures.context: Fiscal year '25 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2% of revenue.

free_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year '25 free cash flow growth expected to be approximately 25% to 27%.

revenue.context: Q3 2025 revenue guidance of $9.31 billion to $9.36 billion, up 7% year-over-year in nominal and 8% in constant currency.

crpo_growth.context: Q3 2025 CRPO growth expected to be 9% year-over-year in nominal, resulting in approximately 8.5% constant currency growth, inclusive of a $100 million FX headwind.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q3 2025 GAAP EPS guidance of $1.41 to $1.43.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q3 2025 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $2.42 to $2.44.

drivers: Investments in AI, Agentforce, and Data Cloud.
Continued investment in commercial sales capacity.

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged excluding Salesforce.org-related expenses.

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud and AI.
Strategic acquisitions to enhance product offerings.

capital_expenditures_guidance.context: Fiscal year '25 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2% of revenue.

operating_environment_challenges: Integration of Genie and Slack acquisitions.
Managing foreign exchange (FX) headwinds impacting revenue growth.
Balancing investments in cloud, AI, and Agentforce with profitability.
Adapting to competitive pressures in cloud and CRM markets.
Scaling operations to support rapid growth in key segments like Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Agentforce.
Ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and geopolitical tensions on operations, customer behavior, and economic conditions.
